message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next()
<<<code>>>: The error is occurring on the line `Enemy de = downwardIterator.next();`
<<<explanation>>>: The error message `java.util.NoSuchElementException` is thrown when there are no more elements to iterate over in the `downwardIterator`. This means that the `downwardIterator` has reached the end of the list and there are no more elements to retrieve using the `next()` method. 

To fix this issue, you should check if there are more elements in the `downwardIterator` before calling `next()`. You can do this by adding an `if` condition before the line `Enemy de = downwardIterator.next();` like this:

```java
if (downwardIterator.hasNext()) {
    Enemy de = downwardIterator.next();
    de.dropPosition();
    de.changeDirection();
}
```

This will ensure that the `next()` method is only called if there are more elements in the iterator.

downwardIterator = enemyList.iterator();                while (iterator.hasNext()) {                    Enemy de = downwardIterator.next();                    de.dropPosition();                    de.changeDirection();                }            }        }        else{            iterator.remove();        }    }e.move just makes the enemies move left and right.e.edgeHit detects when any enemy
